DataElement.preferredName: Breast Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary breast carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to pathologic T stage of a breast tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.longName: Breast
Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Pathologic
Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/17/17 tt associated with CS/CSI. 9/13/17 tt transferred context; changed def - 1st letter upper case; changed Reg Status to Qualified.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Breast Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system applies to invasive (infiltrating) carcinoma of the breast and ductal carcinoma in situ of the breast. It does not apply to breast sarcoma, phyllodes tumor, and breast lymphoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or to the skin (ulceration or macroscopic nodules); invasion of the dermis alone does not qualify as T4. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or to the skin (ulceration or macroscopic nodules); invasion of the dermis alone does not qualify as T4. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with ulceration and/or ipsilateral macroscopic satellite nodules and/or edema (including peau d'orange) of the skin that does not meet the criteria for inflammatory carcinoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with ulceration and/or ipsilateral macroscopic satellite nodules and/or edema (including peau d'orange) of the skin that does not meet the criteria for inflammatory carcinoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with extension to the chest wall; invasion or adherence to pectoralis muscle in the absence of invasion of chest wall structures does not qualify as T4. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with extension to the chest wall; invasion or adherence to pectoralis muscle in the absence of invasion of chest wall structures does not qualify as T4. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 50 mm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 50 mm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 20 mm, but not more than 50 mm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 20 mm, but not more than 50 mm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT1mi TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT1mi TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size 1 mm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT1mi TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size 1 mm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 1 mm, but not more than 5 mm in greatest dimension (round any measurement 1.0-1.9 mm to 2 mm). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 1 mm, but not more than 5 mm in greatest dimension (round any measurement 1.0-1.9 mm to 2 mm). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT4d TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT4d TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer meeting the criteria of inflammatory carcinoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT4d TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer meeting the criteria of inflammatory carcinoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT4c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT4c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer in which both T4a and T4b are present. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT4c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer in which both T4a and T4b are present. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pTis (DCIS) TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pTis (DCIS) TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with a finding of ductal carcinoma in situ. Lobular carcinoma in situ (LCIS) is a benign entity and is removed from TNM staging in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, 8th Edition. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pTis (DCIS) TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with a finding of ductal carcinoma in situ. Lobular carcinoma in situ (LCIS) is a benign entity and is removed from TNM staging in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, 8th Edition. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT1c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 10 mm, but not more than 20 mm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 10 mm, but not more than 20 mm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 5 mm, but not more than 10 mm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 5 mm, but not more than 10 mm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size 20 mm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size 20 mm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pTis (Paget) TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pTis (Paget) TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Paget disease of the nipple not associated with invasive carcinoma and/or carcinoma in situ (DCIS) in the underlying breast parenchyma. Carcinomas in the breast parenchyma associated with Paget disease are categorized based on the size and characteristics of the parenchymal disease, although the presence of Paget disease should still be noted. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pTis (Paget) TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Paget disease of the nipple not associated with invasive carcinoma and/or carcinoma in situ (DCIS) in the underlying breast parenchyma. Carcinomas in the breast parenchyma associated with Paget disease are categorized based on the size and characteristics of the parenchymal disease, although the presence of Paget disease should still be noted. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
